label: Description
value: Vertical sheet containing six sketches of beached sailboats.  Each has a few sketchy figures nearby to indicate scale.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite on paperboard tipped into binding with fabric
Studies of Two Sailboats, Katwijk aan Zee

label: Description
value:
Recto of vertical sheet with sketches of two sailboats in shallows.  The boat in the upper half of the sheet has many of its components fully rendered: the masst, boom with wrapped sail, rigging, rudder, wooden hull and dinghy are all identifiable.  The boat's name is written across the side of the ship closest to the bow: IKWEI.  The boat in the lower half of the sheet is rendered in less detail and seems further from the viewer.  It is very similar to the boat above.  A figure stands in the water to the right of the boat.

Verso of sheet has a single sketch of a small rod with holes for adjustment.  This is possibly part of a navigational instrument?

label: Physical description
value: Graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric
Sketches of Boat, Fountain, and Building Façade

label: Description
value: Vertical sheet with multiple sketches.  At top left, a wood-hulled sailboat is seen in shallow water, viewed from stern.  At lower left a running fountain is seen from the left.  The fountain consists of a central pedestal which is decorated on the visible side by a dolphin with prominent scales spouting water from its nose and mouth, while its tail is raised vertically to support a smaller bowl above which fills with water from the spout above and dribbles over the rim into the large basin below.  The basin has a small, bowl-like projection at the corner, possibly providing water for animals.  The final sketch at right is the façade of a late Renaissance building with only its left side visible.  The façade consists of a large arched central pediment thrust up in the center and supported by a continuous engaged column.  A pendentive-like element sweeps down from the pediment to unite with the lower wing of the façade which is topped by a ball finial.  At bottom right, Roman numerals have been sketched: C D D C L X X I X, which are present on a date plaque on the building's façade.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric

label: Description
value: Valance of white linen patterned by open weaving also known as "red de telar" or "red de Val de Verdja." Design shows a central female figure holding candles and flanked on either side by large-scale stylized vase form with flowers. In the interstices are small-scale female figures and animals. Heavy fringe on the bottom and band of plain linen at top.

label: Description
value: Piece from a pocket or pouch with cupid surrounded by arabesque ornament and three fleur-de-lys. Letters above, written in reverse. Brocaded in gold and silver on a green ground.

value: Given to Roswell N. Shurtleff, National Academician, by a French artist from Paris in the early 1850s. In 1911 is was presented to Mrs. Mary Louise Mason, his second cousin. Date supplied by donor.

label: Description
value: Black linen plain cloth with horizontal stripes of red. The material is closely pleated and the pleats held in place by threads; on the top of each pleat is a pattern of tiny flowers embroidered in colored wools, arranged to form a lozenge design. At the bottom of the skirt are bands of red, white and blue cotton cloth; at the top, herringbone stitches in colored wools.

label: Description
value: This fragment preserves only a section of a much larger pattern.  The design is in olive green and deep red cut and uncut velvet on cream satin ground.  The upper portion of an arch, its supporting pillars, and large vase forms and large scale floral above the arch.  This piece sewn together with 1948-116-2-a,b.  Right selvedge present.
